clinical_study.official_title: Late Postconditioning After Cardiac Surgery - Bridge From Surrogate Markers to Clinical Outcome

brief_summary.textblock: Retrospective analysis of a 6-month follow up within a randomised controlled study in cardiac surgery with pharmacological postconditioning (sedation on intensive care unit with sevoflurane)

detailed_description.textblock:
Introduction: In a recent randomized controlled (RCT; NCT00924222) trial the investigators demonstrated in 102 patients that late post-conditioning with sevoflurane performed in the intensive care unit (ICU) reduced myocardial injury. These patients presented with lower troponin T values on the first post-operative day compared with patients undergoing propofol sedation. In order to assess possible clinical relevant long-term implications in patients enrolled in this study, the current retrospective analysis is performed focusing on cardiac and non-cardiac events during the first six months after surgery.
Methods: All patients who had successfully completed the late post-conditioning trial were included in this follow-up. Primary and secondary endpoints were the proportion of patients experiencing cardiac and non-cardiac events, respectively. Additionally, therapeutic interventions such as initiation or change of drug therapy, interventional treatment or surgery were assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: the proportion of patients with cardiac events
primary_outcome.description: dysrhythmias, congestive heart failure and cardiac ischemic event

secondary_outcome.measure: proportion of patients experiencing non-cardiac events
secondary_outcome.description: acute or chronic pulmonary embolism, bleeding events, infections, cerebral events, acute and chronic kidney failure, defined as glomerular filtration rate below 60 ml/min

arm_group.description: Patient group with either sevoflurane or propofol sedation of the RCT (StV 5-2007; NCT00924222)

study_pop.textblock: All patients who had successfully completed the late postconditioning trial (NCT00924222) were included in this retrospective follow-up analysis.

criteria.textblock: All patients who had successfully completed the late post-conditioning trial were included in this retrospective follow-up analysis. Written and informed consent of all patients included in the first study had to be available.
